activities.loc: Law Enforcement Center - Lower Level Hearing Room - LC300

result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

charges.descr: 3rd Degree Sexual Assault - Sexual Contact - Defendant Bodily Fluids

records.addlTxt:
9:31 AM Defendant Ted D McGruder in court.  Attorney Jeremy Michael Samuels in court for Ted D McGruder.  Prosecuting attorney Dirk Christian Jensen in court for the State of Wisconsin. Court Reporter:  Darlene Shue. 
Parties have received and review competency report.
Doctor opines defendant is competent to proceed.
Parties stipulate to the report.
Court holds colloquy with defendant regarding doctor's report, defendant agrees with doctor's report.
BTC: Defendant competent to proceed.
Status conference scheduled for November 10, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Status conference on November 10, 2022 at 08:30 am.

records.addlTxt: Charges per attached criminal complaint. Conditions: Make all court appearances on time. Failure to appear will result in the issuance of a warrant for your arrest, possible bail jumping charges and forfeiture of any bond on deposit. No contact with the victim M.T.V(person, property, residence or family).

2:12 PM Prosecuting attorney Jessica E. H. Lynott in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Ted D McGruder appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney Juan Sebastian Ramirez appeared by video for Ted D McGruder. Court Reporter Mark Garvin. 
Reading of complaint is waived, probable cause found, bond set.
Preliminary hearing scheduled for July 6, 2022 at 09:00 am.
Preliminary hearing on July 6, 2022 at 09:00 am.

Initial appearance on June 30, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

Pursuant to Wisconsin's Supreme Court Order issued March 22, 2020 this hearing being held via video and telephone conferencing. You may view this hearing by using the following link:  https://www.wicourts.gov/courts/livestream.htm, Racine County, Judicial Court Commissioner
